question: Y in the following reaction is
<katex>$$Phenol \xrightarrow{NaOH} A \xrightarrow[(ii)H^+]{(i)CO_2} B \xrightarrow[(ii)H^+]{(i)(CH_3CO)_2O} Y \text{ (Major product)}$$</katex>
explanation: 1. Phenol reacts with NaOH to form Sodium Phenoxide.
2. Sodium Phenoxide reacts with <katex>$CO_2$</katex> followed by acidification (Kolbe's reaction) to form Salicylic acid (B).
3. Salicylic acid reacts with Acetic anhydride (<katex>$(CH_3CO)_2O$</katex>) in acidic medium (Acetylation) to form Acetylsalicylic acid.
4. Acetylsalicylic acid is commonly known as **Aspirin** (Y).
